Job Posting:162639 - Position: S25 Information Technology 162639 E3 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 03/27/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 02/27/2025 10:39 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Stryker 8329 Eastlake Drive, Unit 101 Burnaby V5A 4W2 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Information Technology 162639 E3 Co-op Position California USA 4 months US 22.0 per hour for 0 Major List $22-$32 Job Title: Summer 2025 Intern - Information Technology - California Job ID: R527814 Who we want • Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. • Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. • Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts. • Strategic thinkers. Interns who propose innovative ideas and consistently exceed their performance objectives. • Customer-oriented achievers. Individuals with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships. Game changers. Persistent interns who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker's mission to make healthcare better. • What You Get Out of the Internship Stryker, a global leader in medical technology takes great pride in their people, and that's why we're looking to expand our talent. As a result, we are looking for the best and brightest students to strengthen our team and drive our business going forward. As an IS intern at Stryker, you will: • Apply classroom knowledge and gain experience in a fast-paced and growing industry setting • Implement new ideas, be constantly challenged, and develop your skills • Network with key/high-level stakeholders and leaders of the business • Be a part of an innovative team and culture Experience documenting complex processes and presenting them in a clear format • Opportunities Available IS interns will - • Work at the direction of the IS Business partner to improve business processes with existing and/or new technology • Apply analytical abilities to enterprise systems and data to bring insight to business issues • Work cross-functionally within the business and Global IS to achieve the desired improvements • Prepare / create report templates for program team to use in future phases of the program where new metrics and/or processes were created and/or modified • Prepare and present an overview on new process and metrics identified and implemented • Project management including project status, establishing metrics developing processes • Define opportunities, priorities and recommendations to improve user experience (UX) around voice, cellular, wireless, conferencing, and related services Update of team training documentation • $22 min hourly wage - $32 max hourly wage and either paid corporate housing or a living stipend, dependent upon hiring location. Job Requirements Majors Targeted: Business, Statistics, Information Technology Management/Science, Business Analytics, Supply Chain Management What You Need • Currently working on completion of a Bachelor's or Master's degree in related field or equivalent; we will only consider students who plan to be enrolled in a degree-seeking program after the summer. • Cumulative 3.0 GPA or above; must be the case at the date of hire and will be verified during background check in the spring • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and not require employment-based sponsorship now or in the future. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Strong interpersonal skills. • Ability to exercise independent judgment and proven leadership and business acumen skills. • Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines. • Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm. • Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills; able to manage priorities and workflow. • Proficient on basic computer programs: Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint. • Basic understanding of computer networking technology Experience with process mapping • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.stryker.com/summer-2025-intern-information-technology-california/job/E88331E630D206CF8A9E989C2C4E017C Indicate your interest to apply to this position in SCOPE and also submit your application package via the online website portal. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may expire at any time. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
